sentence.Network_en: Meggie was so against a fuss she even refused to wear bridal regalia.
sentence.Network_cn: 麦琪大力反对铺张,甚至拒绝穿华丽的新婚礼服.

sentence.Network_en: Every professor was wearing the regalia of his graduate school.
sentence.Network_cn: 每一位教授都穿着他所毕业的研究生院的礼服.

sentence.Network_en: My Mom finally graduated. This is me with her regalia cap.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的妈妈终于毕业了,让我戴戴她的博士帽吧!

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the sense 'royal powers'): from medieval Latin, literally royal privileges', from Latin, neuter plural of regalis 'regal'

entry.tran: （国王或法官等在正式场合穿的）盛装，礼服
entry.def: Regalia consists of all the traditional clothes and items which someone such as a king or a judge wears and carries on official occasions.

means.word_mean: 1. paraphernalia indicative of royalty (or other high office)
